body: $TNT From Geoff Yahoo forum: Peak Fintech blew away our revenue estimate of $25 million coming in with a $30.6 million quarter
created_at: which was growth of 322% compared with last year. Taking out the bank interest generation and ASCS loan servicing fees
column3: platform and supply chain related revenues were $29.8 million compared to $6.2 million a year ago
column4: or growth of 382%. Most of the revenues in the quarter were from low margin supply chain customers but the future growth is expected to come from higher margin services that will contribute gross margins between 50-60%. This quarter $2.0 million in revenues came from these higher margin services. The $2.0 million is the sum of the bank (ASFC) plus ASCS plus services generated from platform customers of $1.2 million. Although it was not evidenced this quarter
column5: gross margin is expected to improve by the shift to using Gold River rather than outside suppliers
column6: which could cut costs 30% for Peak.
